title: Rabbit with White Wine and Herbs
introduction: Delight in the rich flavors of Ligurian cuisine with this classic rabbit dish. The tender rabbit pieces are browned to perfection and then simmered with a medley of fresh herbs, vegetables, and white wine, creating a symphony of tastes. Simple yet elegant, this recipe can be easily personalized by adding ingredients like olives or mushrooms, making it a versatile addition to your culinary repertoire.
ingredients: 1 rabbit (2 1/2 to 3 pounds), cut into 8 pieces
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Rinse the rabbit pieces and pat dry with paper towels. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the rabbit and brown lightly on all sides, about 15 minutes.
Scatter the onion, carrot, celery, and herbs around the rabbit pieces and cook until the onion is softened, about 5 minutes.

Add the wine and bring it to a simmer. Cook until most of the liquid is evaporated, about 2 minutes. Add the broth and bring it to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low. Cover the pan and cook, turning the rabbit occasionally with tongs, until tender when pierced with a fork, about 30 minutes.
Transfer the rabbit to a serving platter. Cover and keep warm. Increase the heat and boil the contents of the skillet until reduced and syrupy, about 2 minutes. Discard the bay leaf.
Pour the contents of the pan over the rabbit and serve immediately.
variations: Add black or green olives during the simmering step.
Include mushrooms or pine nuts for a richer flavor.
Incorporate artichokes to add a slight tang to the dish.
